Name: Circul
Description: The players start at the 4 corners of the game board. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events or traffic signs benefit or hinder the players. The first player to reach his starting point after traveling around the game board wins the game.

Name: Dreamwars: Adventurer's Kit Expansion Set
Description:
The rise of Heroes. From the lush forests to the crowded cities, Ylen can be an unforgiving, brutal place. But for those who are willing to take a chance, each danger hides an opportunity...

The Adventurer's Kit is an expansion for the Dreamwars board game by Royal Art Games. Featuring eight brand new playable Heroes, each with unique abilities, plus dozens of new Equipment and Events cards, this set will make your games even more unpredictable and fun.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dreamwars: Horror Hunter Expansion Set
Description:
Winter has come. An unprecedented, unnatural cold has descended upon Halfen, while a new, silent enemy threatens to awaken an ancient evil. Once again the fate of Mankind is in your hands...

The Horror Hunter Set is an expansion for the Dreamwars board game by Royal Art Games. This set features: a brand new Ordeal set in the wintertime, with new rules, tokens and mechanics, new Nemesis creatures and unique, winter-themed Events and Adventure cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dreamwars: Dark Times Decks
Description:
Inside this box:
30 New Outland Mysteries Cards
30 New City Intrigue Cards

Name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – The Archmaester's Key
Description:
The great battles of the War of the Five Kings have temporarily ceased, but the game of thrones is far from over. The Archmaester's Key is the first expansion of the "Flight of Crows" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game, and as the name implies, this cycle follows the key events of A Feast for Crows. The bestow keyword gathers strength, while other new cards provide incentives for the Great Houses to use Banners to work together.

With iconic characters like Daario Naharis and Mag the Mighty, The Archmaester's Key is the perfect beginning to a new cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game!

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: A Game of Thrones – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Way of the Fighter: Aya vs Ranveer Fighter Pack
Description:
Way of the Fighter - Fighter Packs are small packs of cards introducing two new fighters to the game, along with two new techniques for the existing styles.

Aya is one of the last followers of the famous Hashashin, an assassin cult of ancient Persia. She is an extremely mobile fighter with the unique ability to move through her opponent and strike from behind, prior to them changing their facing. She is a perfect fit for aggressive and relentless players. Her mode card Shadow Veil further increases the damage actions she plays during a turn if she moves through the opponent’s space that turn. Not all of her actions are reliant on her traversing through her opponent’s space. Actions like Deadly Rhythm are mixed into her attacks just for such occasions when an opponent is too far away to get around them.

Ranveer is a well-rounded master sikh warrior, his fighting form is methodical and strategical, thanks to his ability to see the action being played against him before committing dice. Unlike most fighters, Ranveer’s actions primarily consist of very powerful modes. The power and effects of his modes are dependant on the number of power dice you roll to determine their priority scores. For example, Garuda’s Swiftness can be discarded from play to increase the priority of an action before it is revealed. The increase is based on the amount of power dice that are on the mode when it is discarded. Nandi’s Resilience can be discarded to prevent damage dealt to Ranveer.

The Aya vs Ranveer fighter pack also comes with two sets of actions from the Counter technique and Acrobatic technique. The Counter technique for the Soft style makes heavy use of the Counter keyword which can prove very strong against a predictable opponent. The Acrobatic technique for the Fluid style supplements fighters who like to be in constant movement with an additional level of unpredictability and speed.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ashes Reborn: The Masters of Gravity
Description:
Harness the power of gravity itself with The Masters of Gravity expansion deck for Ashes: Rise of the Phoenixborn! This deck introduces a new Phoenixborn, Echo Greystorm, to the Ashes universe, giving you the freedom to explore new deck-building strategies that fit his unique abilities. Take control of your opponent's every move by bending the very laws of physics to your will. Additionally, Echo is accompanied by a full deck of spell, ally, and other cards that can be incorporated into any Ashes deck, allowing you to supplement your collection and discover powerful new card combinations. With each card, you'll find new ways to customize your Ashes experience and fight alongside your chosen Phoenixborn!

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Ashes – Rise of the Phoenixborn

Name: Ashes: The Path of Assassins
Description:
Return to the world of Argaia and see the world through the eyes of a new Phoenixborn with The Path of Assassins expansion deck for Ashes: Rise of the Phoenixborn!

Born in bonds, Jericho Kill now sits on the throne of Abylon. Trained in combat from a young age, she brings her unique skills to the Ashes universe, allowing you to experiment with new strategies and paths to victory against other Phoenixborn. Take command of powerful allies or overwhelm your opponent with magic that refreshes your exhausted dice. Every card in The Path of Assassins can be used to customize any Ashes deck, giving you the freedom to tailor the experience to your own style of play. Unlock Jericho's full potential with The Path of Assassins!

—description from the publisher

Note: with the release of version 1.5 of the game - Ashes Reborn: Rise of the Phoenixborn - The Path of Assassins has been retired. It was later replaced with the first deluxe expansion of Ashes: Reborn - The Breaker of Fate, which included reimagined Phoenixborn Jericho (called Jericho, Reborn) and new type of dice - Time dice.
Families: Game: Ashes – Rise of the Phoenixborn

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Tears of Amaterasu
Description:
Expand your Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game collection with Tears of Amaterasu, the first Dynasty Pack of the "Imperial Cycle"!

The first Dynasty Pack in Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game, Tears of Amaterasu features three copies of twenty new cards and expands on the theme found in the Core Set of the game. Offering new tools for all seven clans as well as new neutral cards to supplement any deck, Tears of Amaterasu is the perfect next step for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Emoji Twist!
Description: Emoji Twist! requires concentration, quick reactions, and a sharp eye. To play, a deck of cards featuring various emojis are scattered across the table. Someone will flick the spinner to determine the symbol that players are looking for that round, then everyone races to accurately count how many of these symbols they see. Whoever thinks they have the right answer snaps their fingers, and if correct, they gain points. After a set number of rounds, whoever has the most points wins!

Name: Loot Trap
Description:
A 2-4 player pirate themed card game that kinda sorta plays like a board game.

Lay traps or play instant cards during your turn in an attempt to lower your opponents health to zero, or end a turn with five pieces of Loot banked in front of you to win!

Name: Dracula's Feast: Cthulhu & Friends
Description:
The first expansion for Dracula's Feast adds 7 new roles, and allows up to 10 players!

The Great Old One has crashed the party and brought company: The Grim Reaper, King Kong...even an Angry Mob!

Cthulhu and Friends introduces VIP's (Visibly Imposing Partygoers) and a deck of 12 Artifacts, making every game totally different!

—description from the publisher

Name: Too Many Bones: Box of Endless Adventures Promo Card
Description:
Too Many Bones promo card given out at Gencon 50 in 2017.

Promo 002
It is a permanent 'Trove Loot' card. 5 Lever, 5 Trip, 5 Force.
Card reads, "Your party has +1 Dex while this is in your possession. Heavy."

Name: Dig it! EX
Description: This expansion adds a set of mission card. Each player draws a mission card before starting to dig at the beginning of his turn and if he completes the mission, he can bring back more diamonds from the mine.

Name: Ex Libris: Addendum
Description:
Now expanded to include Non-Fiction as well as works of fiction from 48 authors new to the original Ex Libris collection. Addendum adds an extra dimension and years of play to this perennially popular game.

—description from the box

Name: Nautico
Description: Nautico is a family game for 2 to 4 players. By rolling an die pawns move along a row of cards depicting different sea inhabitants valued 1 to 40 and 9 Nautico cards. When a player moves the last pawn from a card, he must take it and put it in the beginning or and of row with increasing numbers or start a new row. At the end points of the cards of the highest valued row are counted. Nautico cards can be used to combine rows, but yield negative points if not used.

Name: Sweets Bingo! Fruit Patisserie
Description: Fruit patisserie is a bingo battling card game using eleven cards. Players will play cards to complete a line of three cards (horizontally, vertically or diagonally). The player who plays the biggest card can turn over his bingo card. If there are multiple cards with the largest number, the player who played the card with the lowest number can turn over his bingo card. When to use your shopping card to return all of your cards to your hand is the key to the game. Which player can bingo first and make sweets? It is a game that you can play many times with easy-to-understand, simple rules.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex Heretic Astartes – Death Guard
Description:
A codex for a faction of Heretic Astartes dedicated to Nurgle called Death Guard, for use in Warhammer 40,000 eight edition.

From the webpage:
Within this 104-page hardback, you’ll find:

BACKGROUND:

     The Wages of Heresy
     The organisation of the Death Guard
     The Chronicle of Virulence
     Heraldry and colour schemes for a variety of vectoriums and warbands
     Background and details on each character and unit available to a Death Guard army
     A showcase of beautifully painted Citadel miniatures, 


RULES:
Everything you need to get a Death Guard army primed for games of Warhammer 40,000 is in here:


     33 datasheets containing rules for every Death Guard unit;
     Army abilities reflecting the Death Guard’s methods of war;
     Gifts of the Plague God: wargear both ranged and close-combat used by the Death Guard;
     Points values for all miniatures, weapons and wargear for use in Matched Play games;
     Scions of Mortarion: rules for Battle-forged armies:
     6 unique Warlord Traits,
     14 unique Stratagems (with a focus on the psychic might of this army),
     the Relics of Decay (6 rare artefacts unique to the Death Guard),
     the unique Contagion psychic discipline, available to all Death Guard psykers;
     6 unique Tactical Objectives.


—description from the publisher

Name: Tsukuyumi: After the Moonfall
Description:
The 6th Player Expansion  Includes:

3 Additional Factions
Components to add a 6th Player
Additional Terrain Tiles as well as action and event cards

Name: Gloom of Kilforth: Encounters Expansion Pack
Description: Gloom of Kilforth: Encounters is the first official expansion to Gloom of Kilforth: A Fantasy Quest Game, the sell-out Kickstarter smash hit that landed this year [2017]. Encounters allows you to add more cards to your encounter and reward decks to enhance the variety and narratives of your adventures in the world of Kilforth—simply shuffle the extra content into your game and you are ready to go.

Name: Brass Empire: New Canton
Description:
The serene frontier town of New Canton has discovered a vast deposit of Brass.  The discovery of Brass brings with it the inevitable influence of corporate greed and espionage.  Powerful corporate factions desperate to control this natural resource are already sending their emissaries to the region. In an effort to secure New Canton’s Brass, each corporation has selected an employee for the task of establishing mining operations in the region.

In New Canton, a deluxe campaign expansion to Brass Empire, you select a hero and play through an epic legacy story of greed, corruption, love and tragedy.  As you play through the twelve game legacy campaign, you will be changing the rules, unlocking cards, customizing decks and progressing through a unique character's story between every match.  Your story doesn’t end with the campaign. When the campaign is over, all of the cards you unlocked can be added to the original Brass Empire like a traditional card game expansion. Furthermore, You NEVER destroy any components and can play the campaign again and again from a different character’s perspective.

New Canton adds a 6th corporate faction and supports play for up to 6 players and also introduces several new card types and game mechanics.  What lies beneath New Canton is up to you to discover.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Firestorm
Description:
For millennia armies have battled for control of the region known as the Flamescar Plateau, seeking to unearth its priceless treasures and hidden relics. Here lies a weapon of supreme destructive power, sought by armies from across the Mortal Realms. Whoever can harness its might will be gifted the power to utterly destroy their enemies. Yet claiming dominion over this war-torn land will be no simple task...

In The Box

This box contains everything you need to run a multiplayer campaign of Warhammer Age of Sigmar in the war-torn lands of the Flamescar Plateau. Whether you want to play Skirmish games, or massive, epic battles with thousands of points, this set makes it easy to organise, set up and play. It includes a large map of the Flamescar Plateau, divided into 23 regions for your campaign players to fight over – there are 256 map markers in the box, which are reusable stickers that can be peeled off and attached elsewhere as needed. Emphasis has been placed on speed when designing this box – we want your admin to be as minimal and fast as possible, so you can get on with actually playing through your campaign!

In the included 64-page book, you’ll find a brief history of the Realmgate Wars, along with descriptions of important Sigmarite cities and the Flamescar Plateau itself – the expansive region of the Realm of Fire, once ruled over by a magocracy known as the Agloraxi, over which your campaigns will be fought. It also features an extensive, easy to follow guide to actually running your campaigns – challenging opponents, picking a Battleplan, using Time of War Rules, how to use the included campaign cards, building garrisons and mustering your armies in the regions you control, and some special rules. These special rules add secret objectives allowing players to use some initiative and cunning, rules for trade and negotiation, and possible sudden death victories – these rules can drastically change the flow and outcome of a campaign. There are also 9 sets of Allegiance Abilities for use in the campaign – 6 of these represent the major Sigmarite cities found on the map, with one each for the forces of Death, Destruction and Chaos. These include battle traits, command traits and artefacts of power for your armies to use.

There’s also a set of 131 campaign cards – some of these, the Domain cards, are used to define the size of the armies that are fighting, and provide players with resources to call upon, such as points to spend on re-rolls and Stratagems; the others are used for special rules, and for keeping track of your Glory points – acquire these in order to win! The cards players are using are stored in one of the 4 provided card envelopes, coloured to match the 4 Grand Alliances.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dezign Pak 9
Description:
10 ASL scenarios:

ESG103: Objective Uman    
ESG104: Pulverized    
ESG105: Hunters Chase    
ESG106: Splatter Spray    
ESG107: Put Out the Searchlights    
ESG108: Frosty the Dead Man    
ESG109: Backs to the Wall    
ESG110: Follow the Corduroy Road    
ESG111: Horror Show    
ESG112: No Beast so Fierce

Name: Lingo Twist
Description: In the language party game Lingo Twist, you will struggle to make yourself understood, and whether you have your fingers in your mouth or your tongue stretched out far, you want to speak as clearly as possible. Good luck!

Name: Pocket Landship: The Second Front
Description:
An expansion for Pocket Landship: Free Trial Version.

The war continues.  Battles open on a second front.  Both sides throw more iron and fire into the conflict.  But, there is hope.

Take your landship into battle once again, this time against 9 enemy units.   But, you’ve got resources behind you that you can call into action: an artillery strike, bomber strike, air recon, and more.

Pocket Landship: The Second Front expands the original Pocket Landship: Free Trial Version by adding more enemies and 2 additional assets that the player can call on during the game to help defeat the onslaught of 9 enemies.

Each turn, the player will roll 3 6-sided dice and assign each die to each of their cards to attack the enemies. Then, for the enemy turn, roll the 3 dice and assign them low to high left to right across the front enemy line, then take the assigned actions.

Cover art and card background images are public domain art from WWI artist Muirhead Bone.

Name: Bushido: Bikou – Kaze Kage Zoku
Description:
Her true affiliation is now revealed, an agent of the Kage Kaze Zoku right in the heart of the Prefecture, her true mission unclear, but it only goes to show the ninja can infiltrate anywhere. A ghost and skilled assassin, almost impossible to pin down in melee she is as elusive as the morning fog, as deadly as the Takifugi, her enemies can never know when or where she will strike. The danger only increased further as part of a Shadow Wind death squad.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

This model is only sold during conventions.

Name: Bushido: Kappa
Description:
The Kappa are one of the most well-known of the Yokai, a selfish entitiy who will align with any for the price of a unique named gift. They’re bonded to water and if the gift is suitable can be convinced to turn their powers over the element to create swamp ground to impede enemies by concentrating their will. In combat the Kappa can be strangely strong, dragging their adversaries down into the water that surrounds them and drowning their victims or stealing their souls. It is told that to curb a Kappa’s power you need to knock it down and spill the water from its head.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

This model is only sold during conventions.

Name: Don't Blow It
Description:
The word building family game that’s sure to bring endless fun & laughter to game time. Build words to score points. The more words, the more points you get or so you think. It’s not just about out spelling or out wording your opponents but
developing a game plan. Don’t Blow It will frustrate you and it will challenge you, because play an OOPS UP! card at the
wrong time and just when you think you have it in the bag. OOPS you’ve blown it. Words & letters can be flipped, swiped,
swopped and even added to your hand right under your nose,which just adds to the fun. It’s the game for everyone including
Grandad because all that counts is your ability to make words and have awesome fun doing so. Hey, it will even help improve
your maths skills.

Name: Malifaux: Broken Promises
Description:
After a year of chaos and fighting, the new Governor-General has finally forced the city into an uneasy peace. His Predecessor might have stopped there, content with there, content with the illusion of control, but Franco Marlow has bigger plans. Under his leadership, the Guild has tightened its iron grip on Malifaux City, and the Masters of the Guild have but one choice, obey his commands or suffer the consequences.

Divided by their own internal conflicts, the other factions of Malifaux have been unable to stop him. Distrust spreads like wildfire through the Arcanists, Nephilim slaughter Nephilim beneath the dark boughs of the forest, and the agents of the Ten Thunders murder each other in the streets.

Everywhere, promises are broken and loyalties are tested, only one thing is certain: nothing will ever be the same again.

Featuring exciting new models, two new upgrades for every master in the game, and great stories, Broken Promises adds more options to the Malifaux universe.

If you’re looking for new models for your Crews, a new way to play your favourite Master, or to delve deeper into the Malifaux worl, this book has something for everyone.

—description from the publisher

Name: ステータス (STATUS)
Description:
User summary
ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚¹ (STATUS) is a Japanese word deduction game which uses a radar chart. Radar charts are a familiar way in Japan to show information on things like products or people.

In this game, some of the players are known as 'Parents' and write down hidden answers they others are seeking to discover.  The other players are 'Respondents' try to get information from the Parents based on cards they have in their hand. The Respondents ask questions, and the Parents plot their responses on the radar chart on the board.

Before the game begins, Clue Cards are placed around the five axes of the radar chart, with each Clue Card have different words on them. Pins are applied to select one clue word on each axis. The clue words are adjectives or nouns such as thickness, money, size, drink, technique, weight, and so on.

In this way, the Respondents try to derive the hidden word form the strengths of clues on the chart. The publisher's site includes images of a completed chart where the hidden word is related to food.

This game was a sell out at the Tokyo Game Market in 2017 and has now been re-issued and can be bought through the publisher's online shop. The contents include a game board, 53 hint cards, 10 pins, re-usable marker pens, a cleaner cloth and other components.

Name: Acts of Insanity
Description:
The crazy party game for crazy people, Acts Of Insanity is charades on over-drive where the subjects are unimaginably wild and the opposing team holds your destiny in their hands! Drawing 5 Character, Action, Location or Object cards at random then selecting just one, you have just 2 minutes to act it out for your team.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Somme Campaign 1916
Description:
A WWI Board Game - #6 in the Somme Series

A two player board game of generalship at army level during World War I and is a race against time which begins on the second day of the British offensive.

The British must break through and capture Bapaume before the onset of winter. Can the German defences hold and stymie the British assault with the perfect counter attack? Can you do better than Haig and von Falkenhayn & Ludendorff?

VIII Corps v1.0    
£13.25 each.
Game board (A3, folded).
Tracker board (A5).
Set of counters (A5, not pre-cut).
Rules (A4, two pages plus covers).
All items except rules in full colour.
Printed on 350 gsm quality white card.
Comes in a grip seal bag.
Shipped in a card backed envelope.

Name: Trova il percorso
Description:
The game is a simple way to introduce children to the world of route planning, helping them develop their logic and spatial intelligence skills, with 46 challenges.
For each challenge, you need to work out the right route for getting your playing piece to its destination.
Each scene has different coloured paths, interrupted by circular spaces.
Look at the objectives on the game card, then take the number of bars indicated on the card to complete your route.
Look at the different possible routes in the scene, then place the bars in the correct order on the white spaces on the game card.
Move your piece in the same way you have placed the bars on the game card to see if you have plotted your route correctly.

When you are more familiar with the game, you can challenge your friends to see who can complete the game card first. 
Playing side-by-side, each player takes 3 coloured bars. Take the CITY or PLANET scene of your choice, together with the appropriate playing piece and game cards. Place the scene and the playing piece in the centre of the table and put the game cards in a pile. Pick a game card from the pack, then place it in front of you. The players must try to solve the game card at the same time. To plot your course, place the bars closest to you directly onto the board (instead of on the card). When a player thinks they have found the right solution they must say “STOP”. If you have placed the bars on the board correctly you keep the card. If not, the other player gets to keep the card. Continue the game by choosing another game card. The winner is the first person to get 3 cards.

Name: Deception/CS-Files: Theme Pack – Korea
Description:
Five promo cards, including three means cards and two clue cards.

Means Cards:
Angry Lion
Dolhareubang
Ignition Coal

Clue Cards:
Damaged Investigator Card
Italian Towel
Families: Game: Deception – Murder in Hong Kong

Name: Dispatches from the Bunker #45
Description:
In this new PDF issue of the Dispatches from the Bunker there are four new action-packed scenarios for ASL enjoyment.

The issue also includes Tactical Tips: "Defend the Beach!" by Bob Johnson and "How To Kill Tigers (And Any Other AFV) With Your Bare Hands (Or Whatever Else Is Available)" by Carl Nogueira.

There are previews of the Bunker Bash, the Albany tourney and a review of the Tussle in the Tundra and the Nor’easter along with all the usual features. The scenarios in this issue are:

The Krinkelterwald: What would be known as The Battle of the Bulge started with a bang in the ‘quiet sector’ of the unfortunate 99th Infantry Division as the Volksgrenadier-Division 277 attacked. Can the GIs hold back the assault?

The Block on the Trail to Hell: With the push east on the East-West Trail by the 3rd Marine Divison, they had to over- come prepared positions along the way. Can they clear the trail of the determined Japanese 6th Infantry defenders?

Operation Archery: Reacting to the German invasion of Norway, Operation Archery was put into motion to silence the gun battery on Maaloy Island. Can the British and Norwegian Commandos achieve their objectives?

Die Verdammten: With the war drawing to a close and the apocalypse being delivered by the 1st Ukrainian Front to the fleeing 9th Army, the situation for both soldiers and civilians trying to escape was desperate. Can they make it out?

Name: Master Challenge 5: BBC Quizzes
Description: Expansion cartridge and question book for the original Master Challenge. Another 1001 questions, centred around the BBC quiz shows, A Question of Sport, Mastermind and Ask the Family.

Name: Special Buttons (fan expansion for Patchwork)
Description:
Patchwork - Special Buttons extends the basic game by two modules:
Modul 1: 3. and 4. player
Modul 2: special buttons with special powers

22 new patches
5 Leather-patches
1 dark neutral figure
2 time marker
2 player boards
36 Special Buttons (9 black, 9 green, 9 red and 9 yellow ones)

—description from the designer (English)

Patchwork - Special Buttons erweitert das Grundspiel um zwei Module:
Modul 1: 3. und 4. Spieler
Modul 2: Spezial-Knöpfe mit verschiedenen Sonderfähigkeiten

22 neue Flicken
5 Leder-Flicken
1 dunkle neutrale Figur
2 Zeitsteine
2 Ablagepläne
36 Special Buttons (je 9 in schwarz, rot, grün und gelb)

—description from the designer (German)

Name: MMA Combat Card Game
Description:
The MMA Combat Card Game is a two player game that brings the in-cage action of a mixed martial arts fight to your table.

Choose from a number of theme decks, including The Brawler, Tap Out Artist, Muay Thai Specialist, and more. When you've got a few fights under your belt, customize your own deck. The only thing standing between you and greatness is 3 Five-minute rounds... if you can last that long!

A game consists of Three Rounds. During each round both players get 5 turns each. Players start at 30 Toughness. When your toughness reaches Zero, you are "knocked out!" At the end of 3 rounds, if no player is knocked out, go to the judges scorecards to determine a winner - players count up the total victory points on successfully played cards during the game. Highest victory point total wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Crimson Sands
Description:
Combines memorization, bluffing, economics and combat. Crimson Sands is set in an ancient fantasy world where giant lizards and large flightless birds are used to transport guards and goods between four cities separated by a hostile desert.  The birds are fast, but cannot carry much.   The lizards are slow, but can carry a great deal.

The players must balance trade goods, guards, and water if their caravans are to reach the other side alive.  The game includes miniatures of the beasts that carry the tiles representing these guards, goods and the tiles representing raider opponents.

Besides limited water, the principle danger in the desert is the raiders and their dread leader, the self-styled Raider Queen.   At the conclusion of their turn a player must draw an encounter card, view it secretly, and then decide where to place it on the game board.   Players can choose ever longer routes to avoid encounter cards or risk the hazard to take a direct route to their goal.

If the raiders are encountered, battle will ensue.   The other players control the raiders in these fast-paced contests.   The defending player must decide how to best ward off attacks and get as many elements of the caravan to safety as possible.   The raiders have to decide whether to intercept and make off with individual beasts or try to eliminate all the guards and capture the entire caravan.

—description from the publisher

Name: Casa Banana
Description:
In the jungle, the animals are on the loose! The Monkey King invites his animal friends from around the world. Will the new tree house carry this number of guests after all? The more animals ascend to the tree house, the more wobbly it becomes. Strategy is therefore asked - How do you get most of the animals on the tree house without collapsing it or the animals falling down?
—description from the publisher

Name: ARGH: Goodies
Description: ARGH: Goodies is a set of three promotional cards for ARGH that can be shuffled into the main deck. The spider nets you 1 point for each card with a star, the twin brother costs you 1 or 3 points depending on whether he's alone or with his twin sister, and the reporter owl lets you look at one of the cards removed at the start of the game.

Name: Endangered Orphans of Condyle Cove: Hollow Days and Plastic Reindeer Booster Pack
Description:
A holiday themed booster pack.

This booster pack contains 1 Cul-De-Sac card, 6 Acts of Desperation cards, 3 punchboard standees, 3 Last Winter cards (including an updated Boogeyman reprint, and 5 bonus cards dividers).

Name: Near and Far: Amber Mines
Description:
Golden Amber fills the deep mines, its fiery, cold embers glowing in the ancient rocks. Scholars say that the Arzians valued it above gold or silver, and wore it as a sign of wealth. Perhaps the rare substance holds forgotten secrets about the long-dead empire and their lust for power?

Near and Far: Amber Mines is the first expansion to Near and Far. It includes modules that you can add or remove according to your preferences. The modules are detailed below.

Amber Mines
This module includes a new Mine tile which you place over the top of the Mine on the town board. It also includes a deck of 43 Amber Mine cards that players can explore.

Magic
This module includes a new Mystic’s Hut tile (that is combined with the new Mine), a Magic Track tile, and a deck of 30 Spell cards with powerful abilities.

New General Store
This module includes a new General Store tile which you place over the top of the General Store on the town board. It has slightly altered actions and gives players another way to place camps.

New Threat Cards
This module includes 13 new threat cards. These cards replace the original deck of threat cards in Near and Far.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dadaocheng: The Stretch Goals
Description: This adds wooden warehouse tokens, a start player metal junk token, and several new cards.

Name: SandiaMix
Description: Concentration card game where the players should match the number of seeds of watermelon on the table and their hands.

Name: Sparkle*Kitty: Cookie Promo Cards
Description: A set of three identical green tower cards to be added to the game. (COOKIE, green, star)

Name: Aku Ankka matkapeli
Description:
A trivia game developed in cooperation with the Finnish Donald Duck magazine. The questions have a heavy emphasis on stories by Carl Barks and Don Rosa.

A stand-alone travel version of Aku Ankka that can also be used as an expansion. Cards contain trivia questions in four categories.

Name: Circle of Jerks
Description:
Circle of Jerks is a fast-paced, sensational party game that requires players to compete while yelling the most-inappropriate sexual terms you can imagine!

Incredibly easy to learn! Each round lasts only 15-60 seconds.

Race your friends to identify the matching symbol between cards. You can only place a card if you shout out its ridiculous name out loud!

You can take Circle of Jerks anywhere! Play it at a bar, a pregame or a basic sorority social. Pull it out at a quiet coffee shop or during a boring lecture. Are you dreading going to that funeral for a great-uncle you've never met?

Bring life to the party with Circle of Jerks!

—description from the publisher

Name: Lygari!
Description:
Featuring all original artwork inspired by Art Nouveau, Lygari! is a fun bluffing game for 3-6 players, where each player is one of the Einherjar in Valhalla boasting about their conquests!

In Lygari!, there are 13 different monsters from Norse myth, and players take turns boasting about what creatures they have defeated in their previous life before coming to Valhalla. Cards are played face down, while players claim them to be one of the monsters in the game. It's up to other players to determine if each play is a bluff. Play continues until either one player has played all their cards, or the draw pile is exhausted.

During their turn, players have a choice of making a boast, calling the previous player a Lygari, or just drinking mead. When making a boast, a player plays any number of cards from their hand, face down, and claims them to be one of the 13 monsters in the game. If the next player calls their bluff, the cards are revealed. If they matched the previous player's claim, the calling player must take all cards played so far into their hand, otherwise, the lying player takes all cards played into their hand. A player may instead opt to "pass" by drinking mead and drawing a card from the stock. When the mead runs out (all cards are drawn), whoever has the fewest cards left in their hand is the winner!

Lygari! is the second in a series of games from Green Fairy Studios LLC in a shared setting of Mystique, where beings from ancient myth return to our modern day world. Lygari! highlights just some of the fantasical beings from Yggdrasil, the Nine Worlds of Norse myth!

—description from the publisher

Name: ねこチーズをうばえ (Neko Cheese Wo Ubae)
どーぶつ・すとらぐる (Dobutsu Struggle)
満足したいねずみたち (Manzoku shitai nezumitachi)
すぺーす・ぺっとしょっぷ (Space Petshop)
アマゾンの度胸だめし (Amazon no dokyou dameshi)
Fortune & Folly
Description:
In Fortune & Folly, each player manages their own trading house in a fantasy world set roughly in the Elizabethan era. Grow your trading company by commissioning new ships and direct your fleets to win monopolies on key trade routes and harbors in a race to be recognized as the Queen’s Royal Trading Company! 
 
SUMMARY: 
Fortune & Folly is a worker management game with a rich nautical theme and very approachable rules. Event cards are drawn each turn and serve the dual purpose of normalizing game length and driving strategies that become more complex as players get more comfortable with the ecosystem at work in the game’s mechanics. But getting into the adventure is easy. You start with three ships and move them between harbors and routes to score points based on the price of the goods moved over that route. Winning harbors allows you to place more ships and grow your fleet. When the last event card is resolved, the player with the highest score wins!

GAMEPLAY OVERVIEW:
Players start with a fleet of three ships on the board and can grow their fleet to ten by commanding monopolies on the harbor islands. Use trade ships to claim trade routes and gain Fortune points and direct pirates to harry your enemy company's efforts. Players will plan and then take each step of their turn with the help of their turn order card which includes a step to choose a world event card. Three of these events are shown next to the deck, so you'll have three shown options during this phase, or you can choose the top card of the deck at random. Once there are too few event cards to replenish the four options, the current player takes their turn and game is scored. Whoever has the most Fortune wins!

Each turn you will: 
1) Draw and resolve a card
2) Move a ship to a route or harbor island sharing a way point 
3/4) Optionally, you may get to make additional moves, or move pirate ships around
5) Score points for routes you monopolize 
6) Place new ships for each harbor island you monopolize

ATTRIBUTES:
There are four dice, but they are used as counters for commodity prices. 
There are always the same number of turns because of the number of World Event cards and there's a mechanic called the Royal Court card that is used to speed up games that start to run a little longer due to players' deliberating more over their turns.   
The World Event cards present the only real randomness in the game, but you'll always have four options (including the option to pick a card at random). 
A strategy guide is included in the rule book, so you can really hit the ground running.

Designer Notes:
This game is meant to be super easy to get learn, even for those just getting into the hobby, but to introduce layers as you become familiar with the mechanics. 
You'll be carefully planning your move and thinking like a shrewd trade company manager in no time! 
This game was developed over the course of almost two decades and we're so proud of how it turned out. Many thanks to Erwin Arozza for his contribution of stunning artwork that we think really brings the rich nautical, sometimes piratey, theme to life. We hope you'll have as much fun playing fortune & Folly as we do!

—description from the publisher

Name: Festival
Description:
Each summer Queen Idriana travels to the the greatest festival in all the land. The Festival is the best opportunity to show your abilities to organize street performers into a festive force that can ignite the senses and imaginations of any audience throughout the realm. Can you capture the attention of the Queen and become the Busker Baron or Baroness?

As a Busker Lord or Lady you must choose from a collection of royal street performers and outperform the other Busker Lords and Ladies who are simultaneously selecting their own performers. The Queen wants to see who can best manage their troop. After drafting your performers, your goal is to keep the most performers in your hand for the final encore. Your best chance is to convince the Festival's watching crowd and the other royal street performers that your troop is the best. If you have the most performers in your hand at the end of the game, you win Queen Indriana’s royal contract and become the Busker Baron or the Busker Baroness for the next summer's Festival!

Name: Sword & Sorcery: Hero Pack – Victoria the Captain/Pirate
Description:
The world of Sword & Sorcery always needs new heroes! With this Hero Pack, you now have the possibility to introduce a new, powerful character into your campaign.

Sometimes, heroes are shadowy figures dabbling in the dark arts or renegades from their kin... Ancient mariner of the Talon Coast and legend of the 7 seas — Victoria can be played as either a Lawful Captain or a Chaotic Pirate.

As a Captain, Victoria was a skilled fencer and sailor. She battled a notorious pirate and captured his stolen gold — only to find out it was cursed. The power of this ancient spell has changed Victoria’s life forever — she is a great Captain during daytime... but a cursed soul at night.

As a Pirate, Victoria soon proved to be a skilled fighter, killing her first enemy when she was only 11. She sailed in search of a fabulous treasure... but the curse of that stolen gold changed
Victoria forever — she is a Pirate during daytime... but a damned soul at night.

—description from the publisher

Name: Panic Lab: U-turn
Description:
Offered to all participants in organized tournament in 2017.

Rules: When the amoeba meets this tile, it makes a U-turn !

Name: Monopoly: Steven Universe
Description:
Featuring collectible tokens including Garnet's Gauntlet and Greg's Van along with custom gems and gem clusters. It's monopoly with a Steven Universe twist.
Join the crystal gems as you fuse your way to victory by buying, selling, and trading locations from beach city including Big Donut, Keystone motel and the Temple.
The goal of the game is to be the last player remaining with any money.

—description from the publisher

Name: Resan till Månen
Description:
Object of this space game is to be the first player to reach the moon after leaving Earth

It is a simple roll and move game, where players advance their pawns and obey instructions encountered along the way upon landing on the Roman numerals. The track winds in and out until you reach the moon. The first to do so, wins.

This Swedish space game dates back to around the early 1960s.

Name: Wulong: Chow's 11
Description:
Chow's 11 takes the Wulong base game to an entirely new level. Challenge your skills in big casinos with your expert team to win money and keep ahead of the crews of the other players. What are you waiting for? Hire your crew, play smart, and operate ruthlessly for victory and a big pile of cash!

Chow's 11 comes with a deck of action cards to influence the game of Wulong in your favor (to manipulate dice, reroll, influence the other players, or defend oneself against the other player's actions). The goal of the game remains the same: Throw a wulong (five dragons in one go) or achieve the biggest fortune at the end of the game.

Name: Bible Books: Match
Description:
All Scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness, that the man of God may be complete, thoroughly equipped for every good work. ~ 2 Timothy 3:16-17

Bible Books: Match is a fun game and an educational tool to help young and old alike learn and remember the books of the Bible.

The game contains 110 cards which when combined form 32 different game decks of 36 cards each.

Players (or teams) take turns matching pairs of books that fall sequentially in the standard Christian Bible.

Can be played solo as well to test your own memory!

—description from the publisher

Name: SIGNS: Die Zeichen
Description:
Renegade Acolytes from the church had once attempted to carry out a dark incantation ritual with the help of an old rune tome. To do this, they created a demonic portal over a pentagram with magical gestures. As the rite progressed, some acolytes soon became clear with horror that they were not capable enough to keep these demonic circle upright. What happened to them was not handed down. But now you are in possession of this old rune tome. So what will you do?

In SIGNS, 3 to 9 players try to sustain a sequence of numbers with their hands in each round. They are obliged to follow the rules imposed on them by runes. Each round comes with a further card, so the rules become more and more extensive. Anyone who shows a wrong sign and is caught by the other players must leave the circle. Only the bravest and cleverest summoner will succeed in maintaining the ritual to the end.

SIGNS is the first publication of Rocky Bogdanski, finalist of the 2016 Young Author scholarship and his co-author Kai Wetzel.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ninja Squirrels
Description:
Ninja Squirrels is the game of color matching, nut snatching fun! Ninja Squirrels are fast food fighters. They race to gather acorns to fill their dens before the winter. To help them grab the most acorns, players take turns flipping cards. When there is a color match, be the first to snatch the correct nut. Collect the most acorns to win!

—description from the publisher

Name: Wild Dash
Description:
Wild Dash is the card game where animals race to the finish line! Players compete to get the best score by racing with fun animal cards. Reveal your animal card, then add booster cards to propel your animals to the checkered flag at the finish line.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bouncing Bots
Description:
Bouncing Bots is the board game where players compete to get the best score by bouncing their bots on the highest valued numbers on the target boards. Score the most points to win!

—description from the publisher

Name: Grunts N' Gold
Description:
It is a time of War!

Great battles rage and are being fought across all the lands!

Small groups of rogue soldiers, called Grunts, have broken away from the fighting having heard tales of gold, lying untouched and forgotten, around the war ravaged kingdoms.

Lead your team into 4 fantastic locations - where only the most skilled and daring of players will achieve victory against their opponents in the quest for Fortune, Glory and Gold!

Grunts N' Gold is a 2 - 4 player action strategy game where players roll dice and collect and use cards to move and fight there way through the battlefields to get to the Gold. Every team is made up of 4 Grunts and 1 General and the objective is to get your General and 1 of your Grunts into the Gold position and hold off your opponents for 1 turn while you seize it. Weapons can be found and used by collecting loot cards from the battlefield but this comes with the risk of springing booby traps so these must be collected with caution. Greed is bad but Gold is good!

—description from the designer

Name: Ushimitsu
Description:
Utsumi, the tourist town known for its scenic beauty, has a hidden face. Transmitted since ancient times, the tradition of the cursing ceremony called „Ushi-no-Koku-Mairi” (Ox-Hour Shrine-Visit) still persists, and the sound of hammer reverberates throughout the town at night. The curse accumulated in the land is summoning further calamities, and many tourist attractions are turning into haunted spots whirling with malice. People of unusual shapes cast their eyes upon the power of this curse, planning to get it for themselves. A suspicious chase for territory is about to begin!

Moving around the map of the town, wander from one spiritual spot to another, pursuing your rivals. Collect the negative energies scattered over the different places, and use your powers. When it comes to the crunch, play your trump cards. You can use them either to escape or to stop the ones pursuing you. If you catch up with a rival, you will have a chance for a surprise attack. If you succeed, you can snatch away their powers. If you can steal the powers from everyone before daybreak, the game ends, with you as the winner.

Name: Rochi
Description: Rochi is a gambling game for 2-8 players, played with a Tarot-style deck with six suits of different sizes. It's a new deck design and a whole new way to think about how gambling games should work. There is no betting, very little bluffing, and six different pots!

Name: Rhodes: The Colossus
Description:
In Rhodes: The Colossus, the first expansion to Rhodes, players may help to build the great statue The Colossus. Whether it will be finished in time is uncertain, though.

This expansion brings more strategy and excitement to the game. Introducing 16 new development tiles, a new temple with high potential for players who enjoy developing their estate, a second production option, and of course, the construction site of the Colossus. The game play is extended to 90-120 minutes!

In order to build the Colossus, bronze is a vital element. It is quite a scarce element in the game, therefore creating more tension and smart playing with new interaction in the temple, the production, and the Colossus site. The bonus track of the Colossus creates extra incentives for helping to build the Colossus and it creates interesting competition.

As in Rhodes, The Colossus also creates interesting interaction and "cooperative" play, but still only one player can win this game. Now several tactics and strategies will give more options to the players to seize their victory in The Colossus.

—description from the publisher

Name: Soldiers of the Sun
Description:
Soldiers of the Sun is a solo, tactical treatment of infantry conflict in the Pacific theater during WWII.  The innovative system functions without a map and incorporates a unique activation system that pits units of the team/squad scale against each other.  Initiative can change rapidly throughout game turns via chit draw and each turn has the potential to end abruptly with the inclusion of sudden death chits.  Unit activation is paid for via point system.  Includes 6 scenarios but the real fun starts when you utilize the built in system to construct your own scenarios.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wargasm
Description:
A card game for 2-4+ players with a modern combat theme

Players share a common deck comprising cards of 4 different types of military unit (Infantry, Vehicle, Artillery, Air).  As well as their Unit type these cards also have an attack characteristic, and an event characteristic.  These cards can be used in three different ways -  as a unit, to attack, or as an event.

In addition there are Intel cards which do not function as a unit but will list an attack and an event, or two events.

Cards being used as Units are kept face-up on the table in front of the controlling player. Cards put into play as units are said to be Deployed.

Players take turns with each turn comprising 5 phases:


     Logistics Phase 
         Draw 4 cards from the deck.
    
     Deploy Phase
         You may put 1 unit card into play from your hand. 
    
     Attack Phase
         You may make 1 attack this phase by playing a card for its attack function.  The attack function of a card will specify attacker type and target type. (e.g. Infantry attacks Vehicle).   When a card is being used to attack, you must have the appropriate type of Unit in play (deployed) that can make the attack. The attack targets either the opponent’s base or a specific type of Unit that the opponent has in play. As a result of the attack, the attack card is discarded and the target unit is discarded, or if the base was attacked, the target player will gain 1 damage for each unit that attacked.  The attacking unit(s) remain in play.  Some event cards will allow the defender to negate the Attack.
    
     Event Phase
         You may play 1 event card this phase.  Discard the event card when played. 
    
     Friction Phase
         Max hand size is 5 cards. Give excess cards to one or more opponents. 
    


Players are eliminated when they have accumulated 20 or more points of damage. The goal of the game is to be the last player standing.

Name: Massive Darkness: Black Plague Crossover Set
Description:
The Black Plague Crossover Set is a Kickstarter Exclusive Optional Buy that brings you over 50 cards to allow you to use a lot of the retail content from Zombicide: Black Plague in Massive Darkness. It will also allow you to use all of the Massive Darkness Heroes as Survivors in Zombicide: Black Plague!

Of course, a Zombicide: Black Plague core box is necessary to use this content, and some of it requires a few of the expansion boxes. Please note this Crossover Set will not be available on retail.

Black Plague Zombies as Massive Darkness Enemies

The Crossover Set includes 19 Guard cards to bring many Zombies as Mobs and Agents:


     Walkers from the Black Plague core box are a Mob, with a Fatty as the Boss.
     Runners from the Black Plague core box are a Mob, with the Abomination as the Boss.
     Necromancer from the Black Plague core box is an Agent.
     Wolfz from the Wulfsburg expansion are a Mob, with the Wolfbomination as the Boss.
     Deadeye Walkers are a Mob, using one sculpt as the Minions, and another as the Boss.


There are also 6 Roaming Monster cards to use the Abominations from the Zombie Bosses Abomination Pack:


     Abominatroll
     Ablobination
     Abominotaur


Again, we are not including the Kickstarter Exclusive Abominations in the set, only those available on retail.

Black Plague Survivors as Massive Darkness Heroes

The Crossover Set comes with 15 Hero Cards to bring the main Black Plague Survivors as Heroes in Massive Darkness.


     6 Heroes from the Black Plague core box
     4 Heroes from the Wulfsburg expansion
     5 Heroes from the Hero Box-1 expansion


Converting all 50 Survivors from the 13 Special Guest Boxes, and 23 Kickstarter Exclusive Survivors would not be possible, so we focused on these Survivors that are easily available at retail.

Massive Darkness Heroes as Black Plague Survivors

Finally, the Crossover Set will allow you to bring ALL the Massive Darkness Heroes to Black Plague as Survivors.


     6 Survivors from the Massive Darkness core box
     5 Survivors from unlocked Stretch Goals
     ANY other characters we reveal during this campaign!


—description from the publisher

Name: Cerebria: The Inside World – Origin Box
Description:
KS exclusive version of the game Cerebria: The Inside World
The complete Cerebria experience, with all unlocked Stretch Goals and highly detailed Spirit miniatures.

INCLUDES:

     Cerebria base game
     All unlocked stretch goals
     2 custom-designed Emotion booklets
     Ten 55-60 mm (~2.4") NON-PAINTED Spirit miniatures
     Solo and Co-op Mode
     Plastic tray insert
     Spot UV on main board
     Upgraded components
     Forces of Balance - module (third Identity: 5-6 player mode, alternative 3 player mode)
     2 extra Spirits of Balance (2 miniatures and 2 double-sided player boards


Cerebria is a team-based area control game for 1-6 players, set in a person's mind re-imagined as a vibrant fantasy world.

Players assume the role of Spirits, followers of the Inside World's two opposing forces, Bliss and Gloom, with the goal of shaping Cerebria's Identity to their image. For that purpose, they have been granted power over the Emotions, Cerebria's denizens: they can invoke, move, empower and evolve Emotions to influence and control Cerebria's Realms and Frontiers.

Cerebria's state is in constant flux until a Spirit triggers a Revelation - these are key moments in the game when the current game state is evaluated and is preserved as a permanent Bliss or Gloom fragment on the Identity.

Cerebria is a deep and highly customizable game full of player interaction, where timing and cooperation with your teammate are essential to victory.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mazing
Description:
Mazing is an all new 2-4 player strategy board game where your goal is to get from one corner of the board to the other. Your opponents will try to stop your progress by building and destroying the very walls that surround you and guide your path. If you can navigate this ever-changing landscape and be the first to your home base, you win!

This game is highly strategic and offers new and exciting strategies each time you gather with your family and friends.

We loved making and testing Mazing for you and we sincerely hope you have a great time playing it too. Let the games begin!

What Makes Mazing Unique?

Variability: The game play is never the same twice and alliances are always changing based on your competitors movements

Easy To Learn and Play: Well suited for a wide range of ages
 Strong Game Mechanics: Equal parts strategy and chance

Strategy: Right when you think the game is over, a well-executed plan could change everything

Maze Cards

When played, these maze cards allow the player to place barrier tokens anywhere on the board matching the shape on the card. These tokens act as barrier walls that create the maze that each player needs to navigate to win.

Action Cards

Buster: Remove 1 barrier wall token from anywhere on the board.

Double Buster: Remove 2 touching barrier wall tokens from the board.

Leap: Jump over one 1 barrier wall token. 

     Count barrier wall tokens as one space.
     Players are not allowed to land on a barrier wall token but are always required to move their pawn the full number of spaces that are rolled.


Double Leap: Jump 2 touching barrier tokens.

Lose A Turn: Choose any player to lose their next turn.

—description from the publisher

Name: Raiders of the North Sea: The Mico Promo
Description:
1 x Hero: Mico
2 x Stone Mason
2 x Watchman

Mico gains 1 Strength for each previously raided Fortress
Families: Series: The North Sea Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire – Tech Tools Promo Pack
Description:
Kickstarter exclusive Promo Pack.
This promotional pack includes 3 TechTools cards + 1 instruction card.

Name: Baciamo le Mani
Description:
The bag with the cash is disappeared. The Boss is angry and wants his money back. When he will discover who is trying to fool him, he will deliver to him/her a wonderful present: a nice pair of cement shoes that will turn out to be very comfortable during underwater strolls.

One player is the boss, while the others are the remaining members of the “famiglia”. They try to Pass the Blame to each other, in order to avoid the Boss’s fury. In doing so, they also try to protect their Darling, hoping to succeed in escaping with the money.

During their turn the players try to play Excuses Cards that match with Boss’s Mood. In order to do so, they have to use their imagination, by inventing stories that both match with the played Excuses Cards and sound credible. Be Careful! Every time that a player succeeds in Pass the Blame, the Suitcases Cards pass from one player to another.

As soon as a player can’t invent credible stories anymore, the Boss looses his patience and dispenses his fair Judgement against both the unlucky player and his/her protector. At this point the game ends and the player who owns the Bag with the Cash can slip away with the money. However, if the Bag with the Cash was in the hands of the accused player of in those of his/her protector, the Boss gets the money back and wins the game.


la Borsa con il malloppo è sparita. Il Boss la rivuole indietro e quando scoprirà chi ha tentato di “farlo fesso” gli fare un bel regalo: due scarpe di cemento da utilizzare per una gita in fondo alla baia.

Un giocatore impersona il Boss, mentre gli altri giocatori sono gli altri membri della “famiglia”. Questi si Scaricano la Colpa l'un l'altro, per evitare la furia del Boss. Nel farlo, cercano anche di proteggere il proprio Prediletto, nella speranza di riuscire a scappare con il malloppo.

Durante il proprio turno i giocatori cercano di utilizzare le Carte Scusa dalla propria mano per riuscire a giocarne una che combaci con l’Umore del Boss. Per farlo si è costretti a lavorare di fantasia, inventado storie che, non solo devono rispettare gli spunti delle Carte Scusa giocate, ma devono anche risultare plausibili. Ma attenzione! Ogni volta che un giocatore riesce a Scaricare la Colpa su di un altro giocatore, le  Carte Borse passano da un giocatore all’altro.

Quando un giocatore non è in più grado di raccontare scuse credibili, il Boss perde completamente le staffe ed emette la sua Sentenza contro il povero malcapitato e contro il suo protettore. A questo punto la partita finisce e il giocatore che possiede la Sorsa con i Soldi può felicemente svignarsela con il malloppo. Se però la Borsa con i Soldi era nelle mani del giocatore beccato o del suo protettore, sarà il Boss a vincere la partita, recuperando il malloppo.

Name: Renown: The Game
Description:
Renown - The Game brings back a traditional Austrian card game. The original game is still played in Austria but it is getting more and more forgotten. Decades ago there were many tournaments and it was played in almost every tavern. It is called “Schnapsen”, probably because the winner was rewarded with a shot of schnapps. We have modernized it with a lot of modifications, action and player interactions. We have added a set of action cards which can alter the whole gameplay.

Renown - The Game features four different races: the bloodthirsty Ogres, the forsaken Humfrogs, the greedy Goblins and the schnapps-loving Shiners

Be the first one to earn 48 points by beating your enemies in different round types to win the game. Send your characters into fights and gather 66 Renown which you need to get your beloved points.

To reward the best strategic player there are seven different round types, which give you more points, the more difficult your strategy is to follow. Some of the rounds require you to earn 66 Renown fast, others will challenge you to win all the fights.

Each race has five different characters, who are ranked like this: The Chief, the Warden, the Sorceress, the Soldier and the Dork.

You start each round by selecting a dominating race, which makes every member of this race stronger than any card of the other races. When a player plays a character, the other players usually have to follow with the same race, if they have one. The higher ranked characters beat the lower ranked ones. This means: The chief beats everyone from the warden to the dork, the warden beats everyone from the sorceress to the dork and so on. If a player does not have a card of the first played race, he has to play one of the dominating race. If the player does not have a card of the dominating race either, he needs to send another race into the fight. However, this one cannot beat the first played card.

—description from the designer

Name: The 7th Continent: Comfort Creatures
Description:
There are some rather unique and unsettling creatures inhabiting the Continent. Some of which could be classified as a “walking health crisis”, while others not so much. Exactly which type is in this egg? You won’t know, but perhaps with a bit of love and attention, you might just make yourself a new friend!

The Comfort Creatures mini-expansion is a set of 30 cards that will allow you to hatch and train your very own beasty! You’ll have to take care of it as it grows but you’ll be able to train it to suit your needs too. Depending on how you do so, you’ll end up with a unique creature companion to help you during your adventure!

—description from the publisher

Name: Spacefighter
Description:
Tabletop, grid-based spacefighting (in space). Mothership, 3 Fighters, & 2 "Special" Fighters. Customize your starting fleet by choosing 2 among a pool of Special Fighters. Roll 4 dice each turn. 3 to decide your actions (Move Attack or Draw) & one to decide your distance for each movement action. Spar with your opponent and destroy the enemy Mothership.

Spacefighter, fighting in space.

—description from the publisher

Name: Choko
Description:
The goal of Choko is to simply be able to the last player with the ability to move. On each turn, a player moves once, twice or three times depending on the throw of the die.  Pawns are moved orthoganally. After a pawn is moved, its previous position is marked with a pawn. As the game progresses, pawns become increasingly constricted. As a new counter is added to the boatd with each move, players are able to define areas where there opponents do not have access.

—user summary

Name: Dimentrios
Description:
Dimentrios is a game about collecting. Collect more, and play will be different each time. But it is more than that. In Dimentrios, you play against a single opponent, trying to reach their base before they reach yours. A simple premise, but victory lies in your own strategy. Strategy is a must for Dimentrios. Simply collecting the most powerful characters will certainly not guarantee you a win. So order today, and become a Dimentrios master.
The game-play could be described as similar to a game like chess, but with enough new value to make it its own game.  Value such as collectible cards, new boards, stats such as attack, defense, and health, and different ways to play.

Name: Stadt Land Spielt! Sonderdrucke 2017
Description:
A collection of promo materials (mainly expansions and demo games), released in a zip bag at the "Stadt, Land, Spielt"-Event in Germany and Austria.

Included are:
1. Geistesblitz: Gratis Demo-Spiel A standalone demoversion of Ghost Blitz
2. Russian Railroads: Juri Dreigleisky
3. First Class: Teatime
4. Piraten kapern: Sonderkarten
5. NMBR 9: Starting Tiles Promo
6. Top Trumps Star Wars: Tseebo Promo Card
7. 9 extra large wooden bits from spielmaterial (3 pawns, 3 cubes and 3 octagonal prisms in blue, red and yellow respectively)

Name: Crazier Eights: Avalon
Description:
Sir Percival, the Round Table, Avalon, and many other cards from the world of King Arthur can help you win by getting zero cards in hand first. Avalon can be played as a stand alone game or an expansion – you may shuffle the cards into a larger deck.

Crazier Eights is a fantasy card game featuring classic artwork. Every card has a unique ability and the first player to have zero cards in hand wins.

There are thirty three unique cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: A Poison Apple
Description:
The Evil Queen wants a poison for the poison apple. But only the rarest poison based on a dragon's blood will satisfy her needs. The only problem is, the last dragon alive was seen some thousand years ago...  So she turns to a covenant of witches for help.

Players take role of the witches that compete to concoct most bottles of the rarest poison in the game (out of 3 kinds). While the total amount of poisons in the game is changing, the rarest type of poison also changes, so the winner is uncertain until the very end. When the 5-th bottle of any type of poison is made, the game ends, and only the rarest poison is counted toward victory condition.

There are 10 action tokens that players may pick, and they represent the actions that each player will play on their next turn. You can not pick action token that are in possession of other player(s).

Players will collect ingredients for the poisons from the game board by rolling dice. But ingredients are expendable and the sources will eventually dry up. So in time, it is harder and harder to collect new ingredients.

Players must discover rituals that can convert certain ingredients into a dragon's blood, necessary for concocting the poisons. Players build their gameplay based on the rituals they have discovered.

Each player starts with one Secret Ally card. If the player finish the game on his turn, and that makes his secret ally player to win - they both win! This eliminates the "kingmaker" mechanic.

Name: The Naked Game
Description:
The Naked Game is a two-player card game designed for couples. It's the first couples' game to offer a satisfying degree of gameplay depth, while facilitating an intimate experience with your partner.

Playing The Naked Game is always a win-win, because both players are sure to score! With the perfect blend of gameplay and foreplay -- of strategy and action -- it’s a fun and unique way for you and your loved one to spice up a night.

There are two rounds of play, the Warm-Up Round, which sets the mood and rids you of your pesky clothing, and the Action Round, where you choose a sexy action that you desire, and who will perform it on whom. Meanwhile, collect the “SEX!” cards and play them strategically to win the game -- and a reward.

—description from the publisher

Name: This House Is Haunted: This Expansion is Haunted
Description:
This expansion to the horror party game contains 72 new cards! This project was backed on Kickstarter and features a number of lucky backers' likenesses in the game artwork!

Your house is haunted by demonic spirits! Will you banish the evil presence or become possessed yourself?

Bust out the flashlights and use your darkened home as the game board! Explore your home, avoid terrible curses, survive haunted rooms, all the while not knowing which of your friends you can actually trust...

—description from the publisher

Name: Phillip Island
Description: Roll-and-move board game designed by The Phillip Island Tourism Board to promote Phillip Island in Victoria Australia.  The goal of the games is to be the first to travel around the island.

Name: Kombiniermeister
Description:
This is a tile placement game depicting a highly detailed map of Ostereich/Germany.  Players need to correctly place the tiles in a puzzle like fashion.   The first player to place all their map tiles is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Transitions
Description:
A strategic boardgame by TLM to introduce people and employees to their company concepts.   You are the boss of a company.   Your goal is to fill the companies grid with the indicated number of employees.  Therefore, you can recruit them on the board, or make them evolve inside your company's grid.  Throughout the game, the itransitions cards will reveal surprises due to economical and political evolutions the same way that such events occur in real life companies.  Some are good events and you will be able to capitalise on the economic situation or interestting labor market events.  Some are bad, for example, due to a recession or bad social management on your part.  The game ends when a player fills his grid.

—user summary

Name: All About Town: Burlington, Vermont
Description:
The object of this game is for the PLAYERS, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the gameboard from a RESIDENCE SQUARE to the bank and shopping locations shown on their SHOPPING LISTS. The first PLAYER to return to his RESIDENCE with the TRAVEL CARDS for all locations contained on his SHOPPING LIST wins the game!

—description from the rulebook

Name: Monster Dice
Description:
The Toy Box Monsters YOU ROLL! Become Kids of Legendary Monsters. Collect the Most Candy on Halloween.

The legendary monsters that we grew up with, now have kids of their own. In Monster Dice, you become little monsters rolling through the neighborhood trying to get the most candy on Halloween.

Open the box to reveal your 8 Monster Dice and Candy Cards. This is everything you need to play various mini-games that will test your speed, reflexes, and hand-eye coordination.

—description from the publisher

Name: UrgentOlogyBYEBYECHUCHU
Description:
Byebyechuchu makes debut with mysterious surprises.
Go with Ology for the delivery!!
Sprint, deliver and upgrade.
Map out the best routes.
Deliver the most merchandises and complete the most orders.

You may collect the goods from bookshops, pizza, beverage and hamburger shops. Find those who want to gain some weight. Deliver the goods to others and get paid. Then you will get stronger. After upgrade, you can get various kinds of fancy abilities.

Name: Treasure & Paradise
Description:
"Hsiao-Le, are you willing to seek treasure with me in the Paradise?"

Counting on the happy memories during childhood, Hsiao-Le promised to seek treasure in the Paradise. You also follow Hsiao-Le to this Paradise. It turns out that Grandma left a will, “As long as the treasure buried in the amusement park could be found, the finder could gain the inheritance of Paradise. Can you find out the treasures left here ahead of others?” before she passed away.

How to play:
Draw other player's hand card to collect the clue. Collect 4 clue to exchange the treasure. The player who own most treasure will win this game.

Name: Canastra
Description:
Beyond a Cheese strategy game!

Located at the heart of Minas Gerais state, Serra da Canastra is a certified region where one of the most traditional raw milk cheese has been produced since colonial times. 
Canastra´s cheese is a hidden treasure little known outside Brazil. 
Until very recently, it´s only been made by a few exclusive and certified producers. Now it is time for you to make a change in this game.

Your challenge is to make your small company grow and become the best among all cheesemongers, admired and certified with loads of Prestige Points.

Players must produce, pick up, deliver, and hopefully guide as many Tourists they can to appreciate those great cheese and other typical products such as coffee, Pão de Queijo and Dulce de Leche.

And remember, there is always someone else ready to profit from your cheese!

				
				
					=============Canastra is a competitive open information strategy game for 2 to 5 businessmen.

The game is played in four rounds. 
Every round has 3 phases: a) income; b) Actions; and c) Quality level.

A) Income of Action Cubes
Built Farms on the board produce a milk token and a typical product cube.
Players always get 7 Action Cubes and may get plus cubes, up to 4 units, for each Farm Bonus tile with a milk token they have.

B) Following turn order, players use their Action Cubes to take only one action per turn, until everyone has passed.
Some actions spend more Action Cubes than others. The action of producing cheese may not spend action cubes at all if a player has all the necessary ingredients.

There are eight Actions available: Produce Cheese, Pickup items, Deliver items, Guide Tourists, Build a Farm, Movement, Draw an Online Request Card, and Pass.

C) Raise the Quality Level of one Region
A Specialist meeple is placed on the Region that has produced more cheese according to the production track. 
The player with more influence, counting Crafter meeples, the Truck, Cheese packages, and Farms, receive Prestige Points and a Quality Certificate tile that give endgame prestige points. 
The Region increases its Quality value. This has impact on the price of Cheese when picked up, and also values all the Farms on that same Region.

				
				
					=============
 
There is not a money representation on this game. No coins. 
All the commercial transactions give players Prestige Points.
The way Prestige Points are gained during the game is very  intertwined with players actions.

------------------------- 
Replayability of Canastra focus on the setup of the board, on several different Farm bonus tiles available, where each player may build up to four Farms, the various ways of getting Prestige Points, and also the interaction among players during the game.

Name: Croisiere 1950
Description:
A colorful space exploration board game produced in post-war France. The object of the game is to travel through the solar system landing on the planets and moon and collecting valuable ore or precious stones. The winner is the player with the most valuable riches upon returning to earth.

The game requires players to choose a spaceship that looks more like a plane and traverse the solar system by the move of a single die along a path of small white stars. The journey takes them on a path to the Moon, Venus, Saturn, Mars and Jupiter before returning to Earth.

Whats interesting about the game is that 3 of the planets (Venus, Jupiter and Mars) rotate slowly during play by turning a disk and players have to align their ship towards the next path to move onto another planet.

On arrival on the moon and planets players acquire cards with valuable ore and gemstones. The value of each card is determined by who arrives there first.

The other interesting feature is a fast moving comet that orbits the players course by the throw of 2 dice. If a player collides with the comet a penalty such as loss of riches or even elimination from the game occurs.

After collecting the precious cargo from the planets and returning to Earth players are awarded bonus cards in order of arrival. The player with the largest value is deemed the winner.

—user summary

Name: Five Nights At Freddy's
Description:
Five Nights At Freddy's is based off of the very popular game app with the same name.  The board game version is a jump scare game that will surely make you jump!  You take mini pizza's from the tray in front of Freddy Fazbear.  Watch out, because if you mess around with his pizza's too much he JUMPS!

Basic Game Play
You set the game up by pressing Freddy into a locked position.  Take all the total of 24 mini plastic pizza pieces in red (8) blue (8) and yellow (8) and put them in the pizza tray/box in front of Freddy.

Time to turn Freddy on, once you do that, you will hear the haunting  Calliope style music plays in the main base of the game.

Each player on their turn spins the multi colored spinner which has corresponding colors to the pizza slices - Each slice on the spinner has a number value.  That is the number of pieces you have to remove from the tray in front of Freddy.  On the dial there is also a skip a turn, but in this game that is a good thing!

The players uses a bear paw shaped salad style tongs (grey in color) to pick the pizza slices out by the color and quantity shown on the spinner.  As you reach in, there is a lower level tray bottom that is pressure sensitive and will slowly based on the number of times you agitate, randomly activate Freddy to jump at you and spill the pizzas all over the table top!

(If at any time a color is spun that is not in the tray, a player must take another color pizza instead)

The winner is the one that does not find themselves the unlucky person that made Freddy JUMP!

If playing more then two players, then the person that makes Freddy jump is eliminated.  Players return the pizza back to the tray, set Freddy up again and continue playing in the same manner.

Once it is down to two players, then the overall winner is the one that does not set Freddy to JUMP!

(If the players remove all of the pizza before Freddy wakes, then the game ends in a tie)

Requires 3 AA Batteries
Families: Video Game Theme: Five Nights at Freddy's

Name: A Feast for Odin: Lofoten, Orkney, and Tierra del Fuego
Description:
Push even farther into the unknown with Lofoten, Orkney, and Tierra del Fuego, the first mini-expansion for the critically acclaimed A Feast for Odin! With two new exploration boards that take you to far-flung locales, you can unlock more options than ever before. Send your Vikings to the archipelago of Lofoten, the Orkney Islands, or as far south as Tierra del Fuego and discover the possibilities that await you there. Each of these boards gives you the opportunity to score more points, generate additional income, and obtain new bonuses if you can fill them with the goods you have plundered. These lands offer a bountiful treasure to anyone brave enough to discover them. Boldly set sail and continue your saga!

—description from the publisher
